captions.text: This trailer is rated ‘R’ for Robocop.

Cause that’s how you make a f*cking Robocop
movie!

It’s been more than 20 years since Robocop
appeared on the big screen, and now he’s

Instead, revisit the original masterpiece
that is...

Journey to a futuristic Detroit that’s become
a bankrupt crimeridden hellhole.

It’s a city crying out for a savior, and
they’ll get one in Robocop, a blatant Jesus

But instead of dying for our sins, this Jesus
shoots rapists in the d*ck.

Meet his gum-chewing partner Lewis, a terrible
cop who never waits for backup,

Together, they’ll take down Old Detroit’s
biggest bad guys:

Clarence Boddicker, a drug lord who’s got
a real way with the ladies,
"Maybe you could, uh, fit me in."

Omni Consumer Products, an evil corporation
that does everything except make consumer

ED-209, a heavily armed killing machine who
loses to a flight of stairs.

Robo-suit up for the ultimate awesome 80’s
movie, full of...
and a no-nonsense black police captain.

"Now get out of my police station and take
laughing boy with you!"

So return to a time when action movies were
made for adults but marketed to children.
Featuring some of film’s best one liners...
“Dead or alive, you’re coming with me.”
Guarantee you won’t see THAT in the remake.

Robocop is the last movie that needs a freakin
remake.
What are they gonna reboot next, Die Hard?
Oh no! I’ve said too much!

Hey, Screen Junkies. For more awesome stuff,
click here to subscribe.

comments.author: RumFighter

comments.text:
I liked the original Robocop...but there's a lot to like about the remake, 
you know.

Personally, I loved the inclusion of Robocop/Alex Murphy's family as major, 
plot-driving characters. They weren't even *seen* or heard from in the 
original, and it bugged me that Robocop's family never tried to check up on 
him...that I know of.

Then, the ED-209s. They made *sense* in the remake, being military androids 
deployed for military purposes outside the U.S. They even had smaller, but 
equally threatening counterparts (ED-208s? I forget.) filling up the ranks. 
The original had the singular ED-209 proposed *as* *a* *freaking* *police 
_droid.* (Though, that was possibly for comedic overexaggeration, since the 
original movie never had ED-209 do all that much for how big and 
threatening it was. Considering ED-209's defeat the hands of a simple 
staircase...yeah, it was supposed to be silly.)

The acting in the remake was *phenomenal* as well; I don't think there was 
a single bad performance in the film. (Not to say the original was badly 
acted! I'm not saying that! It's just noteworthy that the remake was 
well-acted.)

And...well, if I gush anymore I might have purist fans trying to yell at 
me. (To balance this opinion, I was not much of a fan of Disney's 
Maleficent, preferring the original, animated Sleeping Beauty. That remake 
wasn't a bad movie; I just didn't like it as much.)

TL;DR, the 2014 Robocop is actually pretty good. Give it a try, grade it on 
its own merits before comparing to the original.﻿

her teenage daughter Anna (Lindsay Lohan) couldn't be more different, and 
it is driving them both insane. After receiving cryptic fortunes at a 
Chinese restaurant, the two wake up the next day to discover that they have 
somehow switched bodies. Unable to switch back, they are forced to 
masquerade as one another until a solution can be found. In the process, 
they develop a new sense of respect and understanding for one another.﻿

comments.author: Terra D Serph

comments.text:
+Terra D Serph "My opinion is my own but no one is allowed to disagree with 
me because it's an opinion yet everyone needs to calm down and not say 
their opinions because it's disrupting my opinion" it basically the first 
part and for the second I'll put it simply.

IT'S A MAN ROBOT COP! It's entire purpose is to be a robot slowly 
discovering his past human life and being able to be both a peace keeper 
and a free willed being.

The second had some bullshit message about man over machine which was had 
some "cool guy cop" modified to be a cyborg(WHY KEEP THE LEFT ARM?!) Who 
tries to live normally with it. Missing the whole point of the first. The 
whole "Humanistic" approach is bull too because it relies heavily on the 
main character being whiney and crying and it takes away from the character 
by making him human with armor rather than the man made to BE a robot.
My response to your second part.
comments.author: Slender Guy

comments.text:
+bodrulm1 I just watched it.

Both take different approaches to the idea of putting a man in a machine. 
Neither is inherently bad.

I didn't find the 80's one any "darker" than the 2014 one. Your opinion on 
the matter is your own.

I like both, I don't strongly believe that one is better than the other. I 
prefer a more humanistic approach like the 2014 Robocop, but I found the 
1987 Robocop a little more on the entertaining side, and I laughed a little 
more.

I still retain my opinion that people are overreacting to the 2014's 
quality, and need to chill out.
comments.author: Terra D Serph

comments.text: +Terra D Serph but you haven't seen it. That's the whole point

comments.text:
reboot was free on amazon
like so many reboots a lot to like but also contrived

lets not call for backup until after partner shot

lets pretend those patrol robots can protect the red reporter against 
shrapnel and sniper bullets

lets have a cop doing the case of his life go out when his car alarm goes 
off like "ho dee hum hum hoo no problem here"

lets make a robot even though he's not dead yet

lets use an un-bribe-able cop instead of a mercenary even though omnicorp 
is crooked

lets let the machine out of the factory into a rice paddy (good thing he 
landed face up in the water, but what will the locals think)

lets try an experiment minutes before a press conference after the product 
has been tested

lets have a human brain "override a system'r priorities"

lets have SLJ say "machines are corruption free"

lets pretend the ed-209s didn't kill him a bunch of times with 50+ caliber 
bullets


but most of all how did a young and honest detective afford that kick ass 
house!  Because suburban homes will only be cheaper in 2023!?!?

Gary Oldman's acting and Michael Keaton's dress casual / action scarves 
costumes are so awesome, but why not have transformer $h!7 come down over 
his exposed human parts in battle mode?

why only wirey exoskeletons for people, why not powered battle armor?

why does the last security gaurd who would let Michael Keaton shoot 
robocop's family not do anything after Michael Keaton is shot (may or not 
have been peter weller or just a look alike, not sure)

better ending if robo would come for SLJ "novak" at the end for corruption﻿
